intro: Aganosma kwangsiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi aganosma, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare species with potential conservation concerns.
